citation.article-title: Taxonomic rearrangements of the genera Thiocapsa and Amoebobacter on the basis of 16S rDNA sequence analyses, and description of Thiolamprovum gen. nov.

p.s: Emended description of the genus Thiocapsa
Thiocapsa (Thi.o.cap’sa. Gr. n. thios sulfur; L. n. capsa box; M.L. fem. n. Thiocapsa sulfur box)
Cells are spherical, 1.0-3.0 µm in diameter, diplococci before multiplication by binary fission and are non-motile.
Tetrads may be formed after consecutive division in two perpendicular planes.
Individual cells are surrounded by a strong slime capsule.
Internal photosynthetic membrane system of vesicular type containing the photosynthetic pigments bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids.
Phototrophic under anoxic conditions in the light, may be chemoautotrophic or mixotrophic under micro-oxic to oxic conditions in the dark.
Capable of photolithoautotrophic growth with sulfide, thiosulfate and sulfur as electron donor.
Elemental sulfur globules are transiently stored inside the cells, final oxidation product is sulfate.
The G+C content of the DNA is 63.3-66.3 mol% (Bd).
